715815f.text:
West 214th Street, east from Seaman Avenue to Park Terrace West, showing this street being opened. Steps will be installed for pedestrian use only. Under construction at the left is the Isham Gardens Apartment House. Isham Park is on the right and the manor is atop the hill.
September 5, 1924
Standard Photographic Service
Gift of Borough President of Manhattan

723177f-a.text:
Isham Garden Apartments, 221-29 Seaman Avenue at N.E. corner of
214th Street, nearing completion.
Summer 1924.
Browning Studios.
THE NEW YORK
PUBLIC LIBRARY
ASTOR, LENOX AND
TILDEN FOUNDATIONS

723178f-a.text:
Isham Garden Apartments, 221-29 Seaman Avenue on east side and 222-28 Seaman Avenue on west side, at 214th Street, seen from Isham Park at S.W. corner of 214th Street.  The apartments are being rented for October 1 occupancy.  In the foreground Lieutenant Sutherland and his Seventh Regiment Band are giving one of their regular afternoon concerts.

In the background may be seen Spuyten Duyvil Inlet, Inwood Park, and the Bronx or northern approach to the New York Central railroad bridge, in the far background the Hudson River and the Palisades on the New Jersey side. The view is northwest.

Summer 1924.

Browning Studios

723179f-a.text:
Isham Garden Apartments, 221-29 Seaman Avenue on east side and 222-28 on west side at 214th Street, under construction, seen
from the south.
Spring 1924.
Browning Studios.
